messages: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:02): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: where does Bing use WebM? or did I misunderstand the smiley?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:04): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: does Microsoft promote the firefoxwithbing.com site somewhere to users who aren't already seeking to download Firefox?
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (17:04): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, here? http://www.bing.com/?scope=web&setmkt=en-US&setlang=match&FORM=W5WA&uid=879B42B5
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (17:07): unless you're using Opera, then you get a static image
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:10): MS was never against WebM, they just don't want to ship the codecs.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:10): For liability reasons.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:11): Shipping an encoder or decoder is presumably a lot more likely to expose you to liability than providing a file.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:12): I guess patents are likely to cover the encoding or decoding process, not the file format itself.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (17:14): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762, that is what they want you to believe.

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:14): Plus, your liability for distributing one file has got to be more limited than your liability for distributing a codec that lets users view zillions of files.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:14): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6, I've seen nothing to indicate that Microsoft is anything but honest in its reasons for non-support of WebM.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (17:15): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762, non-support of vorbis?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:15): Everything they've said and done accords with their explanation that they're only concerned about patent liability.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:15): . . . Vorbis I don't know.  I haven't seen any statements by them on that.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:15): People seem to not talk about the audio part much, mostly video.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (17:16): i am interested in audio. i sometimes do podcasts.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (17:16): also, streaming vorbis (well, anything in ogg) is easy.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:16): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: They already ship VP8.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:16): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: In Skype.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:16): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, typical.  One hand doesn't know what the other is doing . . .
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (17:16): http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microsoft_PlaysForSure#Criticisms
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:16): Like how they argued fiercely against OTF embedding while Silverlight supported it.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:16): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: They only officially owned Skype a few days ago
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (17:17): >The license prohibited makers of portable devices compatible with Windows Media Player from using non-Microsoft audio encoding formats.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:17): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: But the risk is now their's
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:17): Oh, so MPEG LA's patent search has come up with something.  I didn't notice that when it happened.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:17): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, oh, well, that's different.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:17): That does change things, though.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:17): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: Different, yes, but the liability is their's.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:17): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: And it's only really the liaibility  that matters.

7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (17:18): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762, i have one question. if a vendor has already paid or is part of the patent consortium, what is to fear, legally, by including free codecs?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:18): Of course, they might decide to phase out VP8 from Skype.  But if they don't, it seems hard to understand why they wouldn't allow WebM in IE too.

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:18): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: MPEG LA's H.264 portfolio is meant to be about 20% bogus, but the cost of going through and proving prior art for all of them is considered more costly than paying the fee
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:19): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: the number of units sdhipped would have an affect on any fine. IE ships more units than Skype.

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:19): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6, the MPEG LA has separate patent pools for different formats.  If you're paying into the H.264 patent pool, that doesn't mean you get licenses to VP8 patents, even from the same parties.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:19): *shipped
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:19): *effect
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:19): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, damages, I think, not fine.  But that's true.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (17:19): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762, to obstruct the web as a platform, of course. in before do not assume malice.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:19): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: What legally it is is rather non-important here :P
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:20): Since the initial argument Microsoft bought Skype
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:20): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6, I think there's decent evidence here of non-malice.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:20): Such as, they support WebM if you install the codec, which they don't do for any other format.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:20): And they publicly pledged that they'll support it if Google agrees to indemnify them.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (17:20): they don't? isn't directShow like quicktime, supporting everything installed?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:20): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: They whitelist it.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:21): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: To stop things like WMV from being used with video.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (17:21): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, did not know that.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:21): Because a lot of codecs are dodgy and they don't want them exposed to the web.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:21): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: The only video codecs they allow are H.264 and WebM.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (17:22): how unfortunate for theora (hey, my laptop is from 2007).

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:22): My prediction: MPEG LA announces a patent pool.  Google either buys out the patents, or declares they're blatantly invalid/inapplicable and offers to indemnify Microsoft and Apple against them, or changes VP8 to avoid them.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (17:22): wellr, i am a behaviourist. actions speak louder than words, particularly regarding software.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:22): Microsoft and Apple will then support WebM.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:22): But I'm speculating here.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:23): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: That wouldn't make Opera/Mozilla/any other browser vendor happy.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:23): Which part?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:23): Especially anyone wanting to move into the browser market, as they'd have a alrger risk than anyone else.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (17:23): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762, even more so than microsoft, apple is not a friend of open formats when there is a position to hold.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:23): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: indemification
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (17:24): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 is a very clever person.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:24): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: I am? Okay. :D

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:25): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, I'm guessing they'd either offer indemnification to Mozilla too, or only offer the indemnification secretly and require Microsoft/Apple to not admit to it, only say "Hey, Google convinced us to support it".

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:25): Opera will be forced to support it regardless if everyone else does.
